title: Stocks - GameStop, Tilray Fall Premarket; Apple, Micron Rise
text:
© Reuters.

Investing.com - Stocks in focus in premarket trading on Wednesday:

• GameStop (NYSE: ) stock slumped 15.5% in premarket trade by 8:20 AM ET (12:20 GMT) after its second-quarter sales fell short of expectations and the company lowered its comparable sales forecasts.

• Micron (NASDAQ: ) stock gained 1.8% after Longbow Research upgraded its rating on the stock to "buy", according to Reuters.

• Apple (NASDAQ: ) stock inched up 0.4% after the company unveiled its latest iPhone updates on Tuesday and rolled out its streaming TV service for $5 a month, undercutting Disney and Netflix (NASDAQ: ).

• Dave & Buster’s Entertainment (NASDAQ: ) stock declined 15.7% after the entertainment company lowered its outlook due to competition in the sector.

• Tilray (NASDAQ: ) stock slipped 2.8% after the cannabis company filed for a mixed shelf offering, including up to $400 million of common stock.

• RH (NYSE: ) stock fell 2.9% despite hiking its full-year financial forecasts and topping expectations during the second-quarter.
description: Stocks - GameStop, Tilray Fall Premarket; Apple, Micron Rise
